line_1: O Friend! I could display much Learning,
line_2: At least to Men of small Discerning.

line_1: Both in good liquor and good learning;
Was sent to the college for learning,
line_2: And Andrew, wha's Granny is yearning

line_1: That whilst we pay so dear for learning
line_2: Those weighty truths we've no concern in,

line_1: Has nae sma' share o' learning,
Make all our Grooms admire my Learning.
line_2: Which, tho' they're Things I've no Concern in,

line_1: With a great deal of skill, and a wig full of learning,
line_2: So fam'd for his talent in nicely discerning.

line_1: Who taught to play us into Learning,
line_2: That Sage was surely more discerning,

line_1: Right. Athens was the seat of learning,
A comic Vein of pedant Learning
